---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]

-->
- [ ] depends on: #22842

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [e6c6cd47cc](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23295/commits/e6c6cd47cc4ec2d7f31dcee562df699297b7d52e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ NormMulClass.toNoZeroDivisors`
`+ NormMulClass.toNormOneClass`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#22842~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

As suggested by Eric I have downgraded some instances to lemmas. This required adding `[NormOneClass]` as an explicit argument to some other lemmas; but I realised that this has a hidden benefit: one no longer needs to require that the norm be an actual norm (vanishing only at 0), it is OK for it to be a seminorm (as long as `NormOneClass` holds).
!bench

This looks risky to me, because we also have [`NormOneClass.nontrivial [NormOneClass A] : Nontrivial A`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/find/?pattern=NormOneClass.nontrivial#doc), which forms a loop.
I downgraded it to a lemma.
This forms a loop with `IsDomain.toNontrivial`, which may also be a problem.
Downgraded to a lemma.

```suggestion
lemma NormMulClass.toIsDomain [Nontrivial Î±] : IsDomain Î± where
```

```suggestion
an instance, in order to avoid loops with `NormOneClass.nontrivial`. -/
```
or whatever the instance is; same below

style nit:
```suggestion
section NormedAddCommGroup
variable [NormedAddCommGroup Î±] [MulOneClass Î±] [NormMulClass Î±] [Nontrivial Î±]
```

I think this blank line convention is a mathportism, and putting the variables next to the section (as we did in mathlib3) makes it easier to spot what the section is about; but I don't think we have official policy on this.

nit:
```suggestion
lemma NormMulClass.toNormOneClass : NormOneClass Î± where
  norm_one := by
```
I think if you demoted this to an `IsCancelMulZero` instance then the loop would go away (you could of course keep both, with the `IsDomain` as a lemma only)
Better still, one can prove `NoZeroDivisors Î±`, which does not either require or imply `Nontrivial`, and then the prof of the non-instance `toIsDomain` is a one-liner.

```suggestion
    obtain âŸ¨u, huâŸ© := exists_ne (0 : Î±)
    simpa [mul_eq_leftâ‚€ (norm_ne_zero_iff.mpr hu)] using (norm_mul u 1).symm
```
I'd suggest just dropping this, the end user can use `NoZeroDivisors.to_isDomain` directly if they want it.

```suggestion
section NormedRing
variable [NormedRing Î±] [NormMulClass Î±]
```
as we did above

pullRequest.title: feat(Analysis/Normed/Ring): generalise some `NormMulClass` results to seminorms
